actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law

official_title: To provide an antitrust exemption for medical self-regulatory entities when engaged in standard setting and enforcement activities designed to promote the quality of care and for other purposes.

summary.text: Bars the recovery of damages, interest, costs, or attorney fees under the Clayton Act or similar State laws from any medical self-regulatory entity as a result of standard setting or enforcement activities designed to promote the quality of health care.

titles.title: To provide an antitrust exemption for medical self-regulatory entities when engaged in standard setting and enforcement activities designed to promote the quality of care and for other purposes.
